name: Mixed Bag 11 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [C] | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which year did Bette Davis win her first Oscar?
questions.explanation:
1935.

	It was for the movie 'Dangerous' and costarred Franchot Tone.

questions.text: Which TV series opened with 'there is nothing wrong with your TV set'?
What actor played the role of the priest in 'On The Waterfront'?
questions.explanation:
Karl Malden.

	It won the best picture Oscar. Lee J. Cobb played Brando's waterfront boss.

questions.text: Who played the first Chester A. Riley on television?
questions.explanation:
Jackie Gleason.

	From 1949-1950. William Bendix played him from 1953-1958 and also on radio.

questions.text: The beaver is the national animal emblem of what country?
questions.explanation:
Canada.

	The animals of Canada are similar to those of northern Europe and Asia.

questions.text: How many members made up the original Rolling Stones?
questions.explanation:
5.

	Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Brian Jones, Charles Robert Watts and William Wyman who left them in 1992.

questions.text: How many years did it take to build the Taj Mahal?
questions.explanation:
22.

	It was started about 1632 and all of the buildings and gardens were completed by 1653 or 1654.

questions.text: Which United States president was a lifeguard while in high school?
questions.explanation:
Reagan.

	At Riverside Beach near Dixon, Illinois. He was known to rescue 77 people from drowning.

questions.text: In which southern state is the Paris Island Marine Corps Recruit Depot located?
questions.explanation:
South Carolina.

	To enter the Marines a recruit must be at least 17 and usually under the age of 25.

questions.text: Robert Young was a TV spokesperson for which coffee company's commercials?
